p: Clinopodium taxifolium (Kunth) Govaerts is a native shrub of the Andes that grows between 1500 and 3000 m above sea level, in the provinces of Azuay, Loja and El Oro (Ecuador). It is known as Culantrillo de Cerro or Polea de Castilla. It is used as infusion in folk medicine to treat internal inflammations, flatulence, stomach pain, malaria and cough [ 11].
